context: <b5_0>Professional anthropological bodies<b5_0/> often object to the use of anthropology for the benefit of <a0_0>the state<a0_0/>. <b6_0>Their codes of ethics or statements<b6_0/> may proscribe anthropologists from giving <a1_0>secret<a1_0/> briefings. The Association of Social Anthropologists of the UK and Commonwealth (ASA) has called <a2_0><b8_0>certain scholarship<b8_0/><a2_0/> ethically dangerous. <a3_0>The AAA<a3_0/>'s current 'Statement of Professional Responsibility' clearly states that "in relation with their own government and with host governments ... <b7_0>no secret research, no secret reports or debriefings of any kind should be agreed to or <a4_0>given<a4_0/>."
